Simulate a mixture of Spherical Gaussians

generate_mixture_gaussians.Rd

Simulate a mixture of Spherical Gaussians

Usage

generate_mixture_gaussians(n, means, covariances, proportions)

Arguments

n

number of samples

means

a matrix with p columns and k rows (for the number of clusters), where each row represents the mean of a Spherical Gaussian

covariances

a list of k p positive definite matrices

proportions

a non-negative vector of length k that sums to 1, where each value denotes the relative proportion of each cluster

Value

a n by p matrix, where n is the number of samples and p is the number of features

Examples

n <- 500
means <- matrix(c(0, 0, 5, 5), ncol = 2, byrow = TRUE)
covariances <- list(diag(2),
                    diag(2))
proportions <- c(0.5, 0.5)
data <- generate_mixture_gaussians(n, means, covariances, proportions)
head(data)
#>            [,1]       [,2]
#> [1,]  5.6693782  6.4887322
#> [2,]  0.5025622 -0.1164599
#> [3,]  5.1609689  4.8101607
#> [4,]  3.4927390  3.9106904
#> [5,] -0.9871484 -1.7914358
#> [6,]  5.1216938  5.3710895
